rule_text_en: Use the present continuous for something happening now (around the moment of speaking).
rule_text_uk: Вживай Present Continuous для дії, що відбувається зараз (приблизно в момент мовлення).
examples: I'm talking to you right now.
She is driving home at the moment.

rule_text_en: Form: am/is/are + verb-ing. Use the short forms I'm, he's, we're, etc.
rule_text_uk: Форма: am/is/are + дієслово з -ing. Використовуй скорочення I'm, he's, we're тощо.

rule_text_en: Negative: am/is/are not + -ing. Questions: Am/Is/Are + subject + -ing?
rule_text_uk: Заперечення: am/is/are not + -ing. Питання: Am/Is/Are + підмет + -ing?

rule_text_en: Spelling: usually add -ing (work→working); sometimes drop final -e (make→making) or double a consonant (sit→sitting).
rule_text_uk: Правопис: зазвичай додаємо -ing (work→working); інколи прибираємо кінцеве -e (make→making) або подвоюємо приголосну (sit→sitting).

rule_text_en: Use the present simple for habits, repeated actions, and things that are generally true.
rule_text_uk: Вживай Present Simple для звичок, регулярних дій і загальних фактів.
examples: I go to the gym on Mondays.

rule_text_en: Questions: do/does + subject + base verb (Do you work? Does he work?).
rule_text_uk: Питання: do/does + підмет + базова форма (Do you work? Does he work?).

rule_text_en: Negative: don't/doesn't + base verb (I don't work; he doesn't work).
rule_text_uk: Заперечення: don't/doesn't + базова форма (I don't work; he doesn't work).

rule_text_en: Short answers: Yes, I do. / No, he doesn't. Use do/does in the answer.
rule_text_uk: Короткі відповіді: Yes, I do. / No, he doesn't. Використовуй do/does у відповіді.

rule_text_en: With he/she/it, add -s (works). Spelling: -es (watches), -ies (studies), goes, does, has.
rule_text_uk: З he/she/it додаємо -s (works). Правопис: -es (watches), -ies (studies), goes, does, has.

rule_text_en: Present continuous = action happening now or around now (temporary situation).
rule_text_uk: Present Continuous = дія відбувається зараз або навколо цього часу (тимчасово).
examples: I'm staying with friends this week.

rule_text_en: Present simple = things that happen regularly, habits, and permanent situations.
rule_text_uk: Present Simple = регулярні дії, звички та постійні ситуації.

rule_text_en: Use present continuous for a situation in progress these days (not necessarily right now).
rule_text_uk: Вживай Present Continuous для ситуації, що триває зараз у цей період (не обовʼязково в цю секунду).
rule_short_en: In progress these days: present continuous.
examples: I'm looking for a new job these days.

rule_text_en: Use present simple for routines and things that happen repeatedly.
rule_text_uk: Вживай Present Simple для розпорядку та повторюваних дій.

rule_text_en: With always/constantly/forever, present continuous can show irritation or repeated behaviour.
rule_text_uk: З always/constantly/forever Present Continuous може виражати роздратування через повторювану поведінку.

rule_text_en: Some verbs (know, like, believe, need) are not normally used in continuous forms.
rule_text_uk: Деякі дієслова (know, like, believe, need) зазвичай не вживаються в Continuous.

rule_text_en: Use past simple for finished actions in the past (yesterday, last week, in 2019).
rule_text_uk: Вживай Past Simple для завершених дій у минулому (yesterday, last week, in 2019).
examples: I bought a new phone last month.

rule_text_en: Regular verbs: -ed (work→worked). Irregular verbs: see→saw, go→went, have→had.
rule_text_uk: Правильні дієслова: -ed (work→worked). Неправильні: see→saw, go→went, have→had.

rule_text_en: Negative and questions: did + base verb (I didn't go. Did you go?).
rule_text_uk: Заперечення й питання: did + базова форма (I didn't go. Did you go?).

rule_text_en: We often say when it happened: ago, last…, in…, on…, at…, yesterday.
rule_text_uk: Часто вказуємо час: ago, last…, in…, on…, at…, yesterday.
examples: I met her two years ago.

rule_text_en: Past continuous: was/were + verb-ing for an action in progress at a past time.
rule_text_uk: Past Continuous: was/were + -ing для дії, що тривала в певний момент у минулому.

rule_text_en: Use past continuous + past simple to show interruption: I was working when she called.
rule_text_uk: Past Continuous + Past Simple: показує переривання: I was working when she called.
rule_short_en: Interrupted action: was/were -ing + when + past simple.
examples: I was sleeping when the phone rang.
We were leaving when it started to rain.

rule_text_en: Use past continuous with while for two actions happening at the same time.
rule_text_uk: Past Continuous з while: дві дії відбувалися одночасно.
rule_short_en: Two actions at the same time: while + past continuous.
rule_short_uk: Дві одночасні дії: while + Past Continuous.
examples: While I was driving, he was reading the map.
She was cooking while I was setting the table.

rule_text_en: Questions/negatives: Was/Were ...? / wasn't/weren't + -ing.
rule_text_uk: Питання/заперечення: Was/Were ...? / wasn't/weren't + -ing.
rule_short_uk: Питання й заперечення в Past Continuous.

rule_text_en: Past continuous describes the background; past simple often tells the main event (sudden action).
rule_text_uk: Past Continuous описує фон; Past Simple часто передає основну подію (раптову дію).
examples: I was walking home when I saw Tom.
It was raining, so we stayed in.

rule_text_en: Present perfect: have/has + past participle (I have finished; she has gone).
rule_text_uk: Present Perfect: have/has + дієприкметник минулого (I have finished; she has gone).

rule_text_en: Use present perfect for past actions with a result now (the time is not said).
rule_text_uk: Present Perfect для минулої дії з результатом зараз (час не називається).
examples: He's hurt his leg, so he can't run.

rule_text_en: We use already, just, and yet with the present perfect to talk about recent news.
rule_text_uk: З Present Perfect вживаємо already, just, yet для нещодавніх подій/новин.

rule_text_en: For experiences in life, we often use ever/never with the present perfect.
rule_text_uk: Для життєвого досвіду часто вживаємо ever/never з Present Perfect.
examples: Have you ever been to Rome?

rule_text_en: Present perfect vs past simple: use present perfect when the time is not finished or not mentioned; use past simple with a finished time (yesterday, in 2020).
rule_text_uk: Present Perfect vs Past Simple: Present Perfect — коли час не завершений або не названий; Past Simple — з завершеним часом (yesterday, in 2020).
rule_short_en: Perfect (no finished time) vs past simple (finished time).
rule_short_uk: Perfect (час не завершений) vs Past Simple (завершений час).

rule_text_en: Questions about details often use past simple: When did you go? What did you buy?
rule_text_uk: Питання про деталі часто в Past Simple: When did you go? What did you buy?

rule_text_en: We often start with present perfect for news, then switch to past simple for details.
rule_text_uk: Часто починаємо з Present Perfect (новина), а потім переходимо на Past Simple (деталі).
rule_short_en: Perfect for news, past for details.
rule_short_uk: Perfect для новини, Past для деталей.
examples: I've bought a car. I got it last week.
She's met the boss. She met him on Monday.

rule_text_en: Present perfect continuous: have/has been + verb-ing for an activity that started in the past and is still continuing or has just stopped.
rule_text_uk: Present Perfect Continuous: have/has been + -ing для дії, що почалась у минулому і триває або щойно завершилась.
examples: I've been studying for two hours.
She's been running, so she's tired.

rule_text_en: We use it to focus on duration and activity (how long? all day? recently?).
rule_text_uk: Вживаємо, щоб підкреслити тривалість і процес (how long? all day? recently?).
examples: How long have you been waiting?

rule_text_en: Present perfect simple often focuses on result (I've written 3 emails), while continuous focuses on activity (I've been writing emails).
rule_text_uk: Present Perfect Simple частіше про результат (I've written 3 emails), а Continuous — про процес (I've been writing emails).
examples: I've been writing for an hour.

rule_text_en: Use present perfect continuous for an unfinished activity; use present perfect simple for a finished result or number/amount.
rule_text_uk: Present Perfect Continuous — незавершений процес; Present Perfect Simple — завершений результат або кількість/обсяг.

rule_text_en: With for/since and how long, both forms are possible, but continuous is common for activities (I've been working here since June).
rule_text_uk: З for/since і how long можливі обидві форми, але для діяльності частіше Continuous (I've been working here since June).
examples: I've been living here for a year.

rule_text_en: We use the simple form with stative verbs (know, like, want): I've known him for years (not 'been knowing').
rule_text_uk: Зі стативними дієсловами (know, like, want) вживаємо Simple: I've known him for years (не 'been knowing').
rule_short_en: Stative verbs usually use perfect simple.

rule_text_en: Some verbs change meaning: I've been having problems (= experiencing) vs I've had a shower (= completed).
rule_text_uk: Деякі дієслова змінюють відтінок: I've been having problems (= маю) vs I've had a shower (= уже зробив).
rule_short_en: Meaning can differ between simple and continuous.
rule_short_uk: Значення може різнитися між Simple і Continuous.
examples: I've had three cups of coffee today.
